replies.body: Man! Good thing the Gametraders in Melbourne just shut down! Wooh!
How about trying to get EB Games to do it? Too pricey? How about you just make your own stores? IDK!
Hi, we are evaluating other retailers but this is the initial test. We are the first region to use physical stores to sell merchandise so bare with us whilst we learn.

Gametraders was probably a poor place to start as they are shutting down across the region. EB Games and Zing would be a fantastic place to start though; they are popping up everywhere and sell a boatload of POP figurines.
Yeah, why not negotiate with Forever Living Products?
EBgames are opening a merch/board game/collectable store in 2017. Wouldn't be a bad idea to look into it. :)

Just as a thing, it would be unlikely that would be a wise business decision for either, like sure inner melbourne sort of EB's would do well, but the more Rural EB's wouldn't be able to reliably stock AND sell them.

Because i would be fairly certain that the base of customers would be fairly low (even in major citys and such due to the fact that if you really want it, buy it online.)
That's nice :D
Yeah the one in Loganholme just shut down as well. Can't imagine Gametraders is a good place to start.

GameTraders are closing down because of sales they are not making enough because EB games has more to offer its a pain but i did the math its still cheaper for me to order it online then it is to drive 2 hours to and from the closest store would cost me about $70 if im buying just 1 figure so yeah im just hoping that they dont scrap doing this because of put these items in a store that get basicly 0 sales so we shall see
yep, and prob replacing it with another shoe shop hahaha
Awesome! Can't wait to go to my local Gametraders store in WA and pick some up. Oh wait........

Hey Paddy, sorry there is not a store locally to you. We are the first Riot region (OCE) to roll out merchandise in physical stores, so we are seeing how this goes and if we can, we will expand further. You can always use the store in the meantime.

Its not that there isn't a store locally, its that there isn't a store in my State. To completely leave out Western Australia, Tasmania and the Northern Territory is just ridiculous. There are plenty of companies with stores in all states. And if you are going to forget about so much of Australia (and the rest of the OCE region) at least mention in the article that the stores aren't in all states and countries (so we will still get ripped off for postage)

unfortantly i have to agree with you if roit wants to try and sale these things and see how they go only going to a couple stores is going to do nothing for them i just did the math for me to order one online is about $15 cheaper than it is for me to drive to the closest store seeing as GameTraders closed the Melbourne store because GameTraders as a company are closing stores due to sales EB Games destorys them in sales and because of it has seen GameTrader stores start to close look im just waiting for a better store for these items and just keep ordering them online im not paying more money for a product now if i can wait for it

Hi also to add to this:

Each store being independently run and operated, we’re able to post product directly to players who may not be in an area in which GT is located.
 
For example, in WA you can contact the Marion Store on FB or call and have a product posted out to you. Or the Chermside store in QLD can post out to NT.

Here are the store details.
 
Gametraders Marion
Shop 2010A Westfield Marion, 297 Diagonal Road
Oaklands Park
SA, 5046
Phone:
08 8296 1144

Gametraders Chermside
Shop 253 Westfield Chermside Shopping Centre (Food Court), Corner Gympie & Hamilton Roads
Chermside
QLD, 4032
Phone:
07 3861 5000

Hope this helps.

Hi Paddy, please head to http://www.gametraders.com.au and click the contact us link down the bottom of the page.  We will see what we can do to help you out.

We would LOVE to open more stores, and see some in WA.  We're Franchised, so we also need a business owner to work with who is passionate about our community.
Everything costs way too much ud have to be stupid to buy a teddy bear for $40 or a figure for $40

I'm not rich or anything buy I think the prices are reasonably priced for Australia's standards, I purchase anime figures that cost way more than the league ones and just have to deal with the prices.. doesn't mean I don't wish they were cheaper

Nothing wrong with the pricing. I already shipped the Nautilus and Championship Thresh one; they both cost more than $40 each. This is a good move on Riot's part to bring their merch to retail. I know I'll be buying some specific stuff retail now rather than online.

wow, so many people with a sense of self-entitlement. Oh that's right, Gen Y. You are the reason we can't have nice things. 

Anyway, nice job Riot and team on producing quality products. They look more expensive than some crappy Kmart toy but if I had to guess, it's probably because of that quality. It's good to see you giving the fans what they want. Keep up the good work! thumbsup.jpg
what icon do you have?
these things are not even $5 in china.
Yep.. the amount of profit Riot makes in incredible. Wish it wasn't so pricey, don't think Riot made a good decision adding in shipping into the Aussie prices IMO

Wow, they're so pricy....
But I really want that Nami {{champion:267}}
Hey Spiritwolfe, bare in mind there is no shipping costs with these prices so it will be cheaper than buying them from the LOL MERCH store.
Hey Coxy, not sure if it's a typo, but it's bear you should be using not bare. Just FYI
The ones in Victoria are so far away from most of the population :l

> [{quoted}](name=Wolfyy,realm=OCE,application-id=pEj6Ee6n,discussion-id=kExE8HVH,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2016-06-15T11:47:06.649+0000)
>
> The ones in Victoria are so far away from most of the population :l

dude i did the math its still cheaper to get it ordered online because of fuel prices and what not, im trying to collect all of these figures and im just gonna have to deal with the merch store which isnt bad but you know if they were in stores that make sales the results would be much better i had a mate a while back say that roit was doing this but with eb i almost s*** my pants in excitment to see this a die a little inside
Just wondering, How is it cheaper from the store? Off the top of my head its about 30-40AUD (25USD) off the store plus shipping which is usually $10USD from USA to AUS

> [{quoted}](name=Katastrophic,realm=OCE,application-id=pEj6Ee6n,discussion-id=kExE8HVH,comment-id=001100000000,timestamp=2016-06-16T12:20:50.679+0000)
>
> Just wondering, How is it cheaper from the store? Off the top of my head its about 30-40AUD (25USD) off the store plus shipping which is usually $10USD from USA to AUS

ok so if you live in melbourne and you drive to bacchus marsh and back it could cost you about $15 in fuel as the average price is about 126.5 then the figures are $40 each now with the merch store stuff including postage its $35USD which is $47.46AUS i know its only a $7.14 difference but yeah
What about some Blitz Jackets that Riot use to sell 5 years ago and reprints every worlds? Imposable for aussies to get since we will never hold World.
what is gametraders and when does nz get some love?

Hey Vita, we are testing and learning here. Physical merch comes with many challenges so bare with us as we see how this rolls out. Once we have our learnings we can then evaluate rolling out further with different merchants etc. Hope this helps.
Aotearoa New Zealand???? Really are we that invisible?
Hey, we are testing this roll out so bare with us. We would obviously like to be everywhere but it takes time.
Whers the Gnar merchandise? lmao{{champion:150}}

i reckon the figures r way to pricey. like why 40$
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} size, what about size ?
Uh... My local Gametraders already sells League merch... I presume these are not authentic. (They sell merch that isn't even on the website) {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
so is this available now? like I can go to chermside today and get a figure?

Gametraders aren't available in new Zealand too.. i feel like no one cares about this country.. while i like this idea of merch in stores <3, im disappointed its not an Oce wide thing. its once again a "Australia" thing..

Edit: Putting my disappointment aside, i love this idea! thanks rito <3 hope to see it expand

Altho i am super excited about this but having to travel an hour away just for a GameTraders i may aswell order them but the cost doesnt change at all because of fuel prices kinda sucks seeing as there is a whole 2 stores in Victoria one being an hour away and the other one being a 6 hour drive or an hour flight so kinda redundent
Just saiyan, but the figures are cheaper on ebay.

Gametraders still exists?
The only one i ever knew of closed down years ago...
(and after looking at the website. the closest store is 5 hours away...)

would be best to look into minotaur, popculcha, zing pop culture etc.
gametraders? they are few & far between.  Ohhh & way too expensive
